subclassFeature.name: Garlic Bread Domain
entries: You are dedicated to the deities of the tastiest snack ever to be created: garlic bread. Or perhaps, instead, you are simply dedicated to its ideals or the idea of the holy bread itself. Either way, you believe in feeding the hungry and bringing garlic bread to all who need it. You stand against injustice, tyranny, and the evils that all garlic bread haters - like vampires - try to bring forth.

entries.caption: Garlic Bread Domain Spells
rows: {@spell create food and water}, {@spell stinking cloud}

subclassFeature.name: Bread Knife Expert
entries: At 1st level, you become proficient with martial weapons and cook's utensils. If you are already proficient with cook's utensils, you instead become proficient with one of the following in order to make drinks or dishware to accompany your meals: {@item alchemist's supplies}, {@item brewer's supplies}, {@item glassblower's tools}, {@item herbalism kit|phb|herbalism kits}, or {@item potter's tools|PHB}.

items: {@item Cook's utensils} can serve as a holy symbol for you.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Baker
entries: As an action, you can cause a piece of scrumptious garlic bread to appear in one of your free hands. The piece remains toasty and delicious until the end of your next long rest, when it turns into a sprinkle of garlic powder. A creature can eat one of these pieces of bread as a bonus action to gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.
You can have a number of pieces of garlic bread equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of one) conjured at one time. If you conjure more, the oldest turns to powder early.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Satiate Hunger
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to feed those who need it.

As an action, you present your holy symbol to unleash a wave of food power. Choose up to 10 creatures within 30 feet of you (possibly including yourself). Each creature gains enough nutrients to survive and becomes comfortably full no matter how much they eat for 24 hours. They also each regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} plus half of your cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Food Coma
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity to curse a creature as if they had overindulged.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and target one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. They must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain 2 levels of exhaustion. If they had a level of exhaustion prior to failing the saving throw, they instead gain only 1 level of exhaustion.

subclassFeature.name: Garlic Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with garlicky energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {@dice 1d8} acid damage to the target. If the target is undead, the extra damage is instead {@dice 2d8}.
When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}. If the target is undead, the extra damage is instead {@dice 3d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Delicious Vengeance
entries: At 17th level, if a creature within 60 feet of you has damaged you since the end of your last turn, you can spend your action to force them to make a Constitution saving throw against your cleric spell save DC. If they fail the saving throw, they gain 6 levels of exhaustion. If they succeed, they instead gain only 2 levels of exhaustion. Once you have used this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.
